thread.title: Coronation Street spoilers: Heartbroken Michelle turns to Robert for comfort
thread.title_full: Coronation Street spoilers: Heartbroken Michelle turns to Robert for comfort

author: Jennifer Rodger
title: Coronation Street spoilers: Heartbroken Michelle turns to Robert for comfort
text:
Michelle with Robert (Photo: ITV) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
As Steve and Michelle fall apart in grief in Coronation Street , she seeks comfort in another man’s arms. First, Michelle forces herself to put on some make-up and a pair of heels and leave her bedroom. At lunch with her husband, she reacts badly to Steve cautioning her to slow down on the wine. She loudly raises a toast to her dead baby and storms out upset. 
Steve, Tim, Robert, Johnny and Kate set out to find her. But it’s infatuated Robert who gets to her first, and a vulnerable Michelle leans in for a kiss with the handsome chef. The pair then visit Ruairi at the Chapel of Rest. 
Meanwhile, Steve is desperately worried about his wife and eventually gets to the Chapel and finds his wife asleep on the chair. It’s a turning point. Michelle wakes up and together they arrange for Billy to conduct an emotional funeral with just his parents present. Road rage Simon is caught in the crossfire (Photo: ITV) 
The anti-bromance between Peter and Nick ends in a terrifying accident this week. Peter has taken a job at Street Cars, and his first customer turns out to be Nick. The rivals start arguing, with Nick mocking Peter for being a hopeless father. And when Peter snaps and orders him out of the cab, Nick throws open the door and Simon’s hand is caught. 
Both Nick and Peter rightly blame themselves. The boy’s dislocated finger can be healed, but what about Peter and Nick’s broken relationship? Party on for Tracy Tracy, Daniel and Luke celebrate (Photo: ITV) 
When she last celebrated a significant birthday, Tracy Barlow was locked up. Now, ten years later, she’s hitting the big 4-0, and her life has definitely turned around. 
We wouldn’t go as far as to say there won’t be more fights in the future, but it’s all quiet on the home front right now. 
But her birthday doesn’t go without a hitch. Although Daniel gives her a wine-appreciation course, Adam has forgotten, and Ken absents himself from her special lunch. 
Then things go from bad to worse, and it’s down to boyfriend Luke to save the day with his present. No pressure, then!
